attributes.action: Have car-free days in London in memory of cyclists
attributes.additional_details:
In January PM2.5 levels surpassed Beijing, and NO2 did in 2014:
http://bit.ly/2kollGb

New Dehli did it, and showed decreases in PM2.5:
http://bit.ly/1PS69st

Paris did it and showed decreases in NO2:
http://bit.ly/2lDwyPp
attributes.background: With this week's three cyclist deaths and the spike in London's air pollution levels last month we need to decrease the amount of traffic in London. We request the government implements days when all vehicles except local buses and service vehicles for disabilities are banned from A406/A205 inwards.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the issue you raise is not the responsibility of the Government or Parliament. Responsibility for managing London's road network is shared between Transport for London (TfL) and the 32 London boroughs. TfL is accountable to the London Assembly. 

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here: 

https://www.london.gov.uk/mayor-assembly/london-assembly/take-part/petitions
